channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- Dell Repository Manager (DRM)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- Dell Repository Manager (DRM)

item.title: CVE-2023-44292|2024-08-14T18:08:11.988Z -- dell -- dell%20repository%20manager%20%28drm%29
item.description: Dell Repository Manager, 3.4.3 and prior, contains an Improper Access Control vulnerability in its installation module. A local low-privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to gaining escalated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-28976|2024-08-02T01:03:51.382Z -- dell -- dell%20repository%20manager%20%28drm%29
item.description: Dell Repository Manager, versions prior to 3.4.5, contains a Path Traversal vulnerability in API module. A local attacker with low privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized write access to the files stored on the server filesystem with the privileges of the running web application.

item.title: CVE-2024-28977|2024-08-02T01:03:51.498Z -- dell -- dell%20repository%20manager%20%28drm%29
item.description: Dell Repository Manager, versions 3.4.2 through 3.4.4,contains a Path Traversal vulnerability in logger module. A local attacker with low privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized read access to the files stored on the server filesystem with the privileges of the running web application.

item.title: CVE-2024-28977|2024-06-04T18:03:39.381Z -- dell -- dell%20repository%20manager%20%28drm%29
item.description: Dell Repository Manager, versions 3.4.2 through 3.4.4,contains a Path Traversal vulnerability in logger module. A local attacker with low privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized read access to the files stored on the server filesystem with the privileges of the running web application.

item.title: CVE-2024-28976|2024-04-24T08:01:53.090Z -- dell -- dell%20repository%20manager%20%28drm%29
item.description: Dell Repository Manager, versions prior to 3.4.5, contains a Path Traversal vulnerability in API module. A local attacker with low privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized write access to the files stored on the server filesystem with the privileges of the running web application.
